ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned different techniques that are often used in an organic chemistry lab (reflux, distillation, separation, reading IR spectra, vacuum filtration). I also learned how to read a safety data sheet and understand the hazards associated with different chemicals, as well as write scientific papers/reports.
Learned principle chemistry skills and critical analysis as well as how to become a better scientific writer

Techniques in organic chemistry like extraction, recrystallization, melt point analysis, IR, TLC, and distillation. How to keep lab notes concise and professional. How to read safety data sheets and be safe and prepared in the lab. Writing experimental plans. Good foundation in professional scientific writing and reporting.

I went into this class thinking that lab was a experience meant to be suffered through. Alas, DiMeglio changed my mind and I'm a confident lab student and don't feel worried about my work or the quality of my lab time.
I learned how many different safety practices, the reflux technique, distillation, recrystallization to purify crystals and how to read  SDS page.

This course taught me the details about lab techniques, even though I was not in lab in-person, but mainly it taught me how to compose scientific lab notes, chemical tables, and reports. I hadn't had any experience writing a more formal report (other than a typical lab report), but learning how to format, synthesize, and revise a more formal article style report was a great experience.
Skills necessary to operate safely and efficiently in a chemistry lab
I learned a lot about lab techniqeus.
I learned how to write scientifically and how to apply organic chemistry concepts to lab.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One major strength is that the teaching staff provide a lot of clear guidance and feedback on assignments. Even though the course only lasted five weeks, I felt like I was able to perfect my writing when it came to lab notes and experimental plans. I wish we could have had a little more practice with writing scientific papers/reports, but I understand our time is constrained during the summer. But overall, this course is so much better and more helpful than gen chem lab!

Strengths - weekly meetings with breakout rooms to break down lab info 
Weaknesses - more clear on grading, depending on teacher or TA, grading differed greatly

Strengths: teaching staff was AMAZING and made the course very worthwhile and enjoyable. Its clear the class is meant to enhance and develop student learning. Experiments were pretty interesting and had products relevant to biology, pharmaceuticals, and medicine as well as the chemical concept at hand. 
Weaknesses: The grading distribution is a bit wonky in that your grade largely depends on the two post labs, but overall its not really that much of an issue - grading is generally pretty generous! This class is also a lot of work for only a half credit. Should probably be 1 credit.

Online lab is really tricky to organize, but this course was very well organized to capitalize on the parts of lab that could be done online and not try to force the parts that were impossible to do online. The quizzes were somewhat difficult, but short. The EP's and LN's took significantly more time than I thought they would, but we received a lot of feedback on them in the first few weeks before they were graded which was helpful to know what was expected, and throughout the session. The videos were informative and succinct.
The only thing I could think to improve was the lab quizzes I thought they were pretty challenging with the very short time period.
The professor is amazing but obviously there is always something lost in having a lab class online. Generally, it was a well taught class though.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course. It's a lot faster than the fall or spring versions, which makes keeping up with the coursework pretty difficult. But the teaching staff are really nice and always willing to work with your schedule. Also, taking it during the summer allowed me to focus a lot of my energy on the class compared to the school year where you'd have to balance this class with your other ones.
Yes, if needed for med school or chem major

Yes!!! After struggling through gen chem lab, this was so much better! I learned so much even from taking this course online and highly recommend to any STEM students. The grading is very focused on improvement  and developing your skills as a chemist, and it was a lot less stressful than the other chem labs Ive taken.

I think I would. Its very likely youre taking this as a requirement so you dont have much of a choice but its really not a bad lab class, especially compared to gen chem! The focus is on student learning rather than critique on how well you can synthesize something or carry out the experiment.
Yes, you learn so much and the labs are interesting, applicable, and fun.

Definitely. It was doable (a lot of work when combined with the lecture course over the summer), but in general, SO MUCH more enjoyable than Gen Chem lab. If you are scared away by gen chem lab, think again because this is a very very different lab experience. Dr. DiMeglio is amazing and the experiments are interesting and engaging. The writing isn't overwhelming and it is really beneficial to learn the type of scientific writing that is required of you in this course.
Yes, I would recommend this course. Compared to general chemistry lab, this class was a lot less work, and it actually felt like I was learning something. The assignments were manageable and fair.
Yes, if you have to take it, it's a great lab class.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: CHEM S222 01 - Lab for Organic Chemistry I
